data.name: scansite-tools
data.description: Scansite searches for motifs within proteins that are likely to be phosphorylated by specific protein kinases or bind to domains such as SH2 domains, 14-3-3 domains or PDZ domains.

evidence: "Scansite searches for motifs within proteins that are likely to be phosphorylated by specific protein kinases or bind to domains..." (describes a domain-specific analysis application).
"In the graphical output, the candidate motifs are superimposed on the predicted domain structure of the protein." (indicates an end-user application producing analysis/figures).

"If you use Scansite in your research, please cite: Scansite 2.0: proteome-wide prediction of cell signaling interactions using short sequence motifs" (explicit research usage; distribution is via this code repository with no mention of package managers or binaries).
